title: Quiz 4: Emerging Health Challenges
description: Examine global health issues including climate change, globalization, and emerging infectious diseases.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a fundamental cause of the recent re-emergence of infectious diseases?
questions.explanation: Urban crowding, along with travel and environmental changes, facilitates the spread of infections.
questions.hint: Think about where people live and how close they are to each other.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ Revolution in the 1970s and 80s largely averted widespread famine but is now being re-evaluated due to environmental impacts.
questions.explanation: The Green Revolution increased agricultural production but has environmental consequences.

questions.question: Which direct health risks are associated with global climate change? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Climate change increases heatwaves, storms, and expands the range of disease vectors (like mosquitoes).

questions.question: According to the study material, life expectancy has continued to rise in all regions of the world without interruption since the 1980s.
questions.explanation: False. Life expectancy has declined in regions like Russia (social disintegration) and sub-Saharan Africa (HIV/AIDS).
questions.hint: Think about the impact of HIV/AIDS in Africa.

questions.question: Match the global issue with its impact on health:

pairs.right: Heatwaves and changing disease vector ranges
Movement of unhealthy goods (tobacco, fast food)
Loss of skilled health professionals from poor countries

questions.explanation: Each global trend has specific health consequences discussed in the text.
questions.hint: Brain drain involves people moving away.

questions.question: Which specific Millennium Development Goal (MDG) is described as the necessary basis for all other goals, including health?
questions.explanation: Without environmental sustainability (MDG #7), the biophysical support systems for health and economy collapse.
questions.hint: It relates to the planet and nature.

questions.question: What is the '10/90 gap' mentioned in the context of infectious diseases?

options.text: 10% of people have 90% of the wealth
10% of health resources are directed at 90% of the global disease burden
90% of people live on 10% of the land

questions.explanation: The 10/90 gap refers to the inequity where only 10% of global health research resources are spent on conditions that account for 90% of the global disease burden.
questions.hint: It's about the mismatch between resources and health problems.

questions.question: Order the causal chain of environmental impact on health:
questions.explanation: Human activity causes environmental change, which disrupts systems, leading to health impacts.
